Localization.Value: Hello, milord, you've only just taken up your post, so let's go over the main things you should know
There are the cards for your units.
Select a card and click on card in the deck to replace it, and you can form your deck.
Let's go back to the battle menu.
This is where your chests will be stored and opened.
You're asking what the chests are?! Chests with cards, of course.
For each duel victory, you will receive a chest of varying quality.
By the way, your units also vary in quality. And, of course, higher-quality cards are easier to find in higher-quality chests.
It takes time to open the chest, but there's always a way to speed things up a bit.
Now let's move on to the list of the strongest.
This is a list of the strongest kings.
By defeating the opponent, you will also receive goblets, and the number of goblets determines the power of the king.
Your main goal is to become the most powerful king of these lands!
That's all for now. See you on the battle field.
Each side has two defensive towers and a main tower. A crown is awarded for destroying a tower.
The side with the most crowns at the end of the battle will win.
But don't think you can sit in defense forever. The whole duel only lasts 3 minutes.
Here are the cards that can be placed on the board.
Note that elixir is required to place a unit.
Elixir is a special mixture needed to turn cards into units.
You'd better not know where it comes from, but one thing I can tell you for sure, your servants work non-stop to keep your supplies from running out.
A card that will fall into your hand after using another card from your hand is nearby.
Well, I don't think I've forgotten anything. The battle has already begun. Good luck to you!
